description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The AV Engineering team at Google develops exciting Audio Visual products that are used by Googlers throughout the globe and have a direct impact on productivity and the Google brand. The products we build range from internal video conferencing lecture halls (Tech Talks) to DIY labs supporting user experience research, automated background audio systems, and integrated/automated lobby experiences at Google. We also partner closely with various Google product areas (PAs) to integrate the best of Google technology into our internal offerings.

As a Program Manager in Audio Visual Product Integration, you will get to build products, working closely with internal Engineering teams and other Google product areas to apply the latest of Google technologies to our products. You will also manage and maintain the Google AV product roadmap and portfolio and the end-to-end product development lifecycle for all Google AV products across our four key customer experience areas (i.e., Event Spaces, Lobby Experiences, Workspace Augmentation, and Special Customers ).

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience leading or managing cross-functional hardware and/or software product development activities.
  • 5 years of experience leading agile work planning, feature prioritization, and cross-functional program management activities.
  • Experience working in a technical domain (i.e., hardware, infrastructure, and software).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with product development in Hardware/AV/IT/Networking or software development for hardware products.
  • Excellent strategic skills around product prioritization, pricing, and supply chain strategy.
  • Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills conducive to team development.
  • Interest in AV/VC technology, open standards and open source.
responsibilities:
• Manage and drive the end-to-end AV product lifecycle management involving cross-functional teams, and focus on launching new products that meet user requirements, are easily deployable at scale, and have a clear support model defined.
  • Act as the user advocate for new Audio Video products. Be the point of contact for the product to the business/external partners working closely with UX researchers.
  • Work in collaboration with partner teams (e.g., Operations, Design Engineering, Support, Deployments, Real Estate Services, other Corporate Engineering partner teams, Other Google Product Areas) to develop, manage, and drive product development activities.
  • Manage strategic cross functional engagement activities across multiple teams.
  • Establish operational models including training documentation, troubleshooting guides, deployment guidelines, etc. Lead the launch and landing of the product.
title: Program Manager, Audio Visual Product Integration
